properties.description: Tucked away on the waterfront, Appledore Library is a small but busy branch that is an important part of the local community. The library is open four days a week offers the full range of library services for adults and children.

properties.description: Braunton Library invites you to enjoy our warm, friendly and welcoming library this winter. We are offering free tea, coffee and free activities e.g. jigsaws, newspapers, adult colouring etc.

properties.description: Drop-in Day centre where people can get warm food, a shower and clean clothes free as well as agency referrals for services and additional help and support. Starting with immediate effect on Mondays to Thursdays from 11am until 1pm.

properties.title: North Devon Voluntary Service

properties.description: Warm space every Monday and Wednesday afternoon, starting in January 2023. The room is accessible from Rolle's Quay while club members are in attendance, and there is a stairlift for those with restricted mobility and an accessible toilet. There is also a kitchen where visitors may use the facilities to warm up food for themselves, and hot drinks will be available. No need to book, just turn up.
properties.title: Barnstaple Pilot Gig Club.

properties.description: There are groups ranging from Bounce and Rhyme for babies and toddlers to their Wednesday Wanderers walking group for 55s and over. Why not go to their new Tea and Chat on Fridays from 1.30pm to 3.30pm? It's free! If you’re a new parent or carer, you can take your baby and use their free weighing facilities to chart your baby's growth. Their free coat rails have been running for several years and will again be offering a chance to both donate and take a warm winter coat. You can just help yourself, no questions asked. If you’re job hunting, their Work Club will help you with one-to-one support in CV writing, developing your skills and applying for jobs online. Starting or developing a business? Their Business and Intellectual Property Centre is right there with courses, webinars, one-to-one coaching and advice at bipc@librariesunlimited.org.uk

properties.description: Pop-in sessions are being held at The Voice's community room every Thursday and Friday morning between 10am and 12pm. All are welcome with no registration necessary. A £1 fee includes hot drinks and biscuits, but no one will be turned away if they cannot pay.

properties.description: Community coffee mornings are being held every second Monday of the month between 10am and 12.30pm. A men's breakfast for those living in and around the village is planned for the first and third Monday of each month from 7.15am until 9am.

properties.description: Coffee afternoon in the Church Hall (known as the Iron Room) every Thursday until the end of March. Sessions start at 12.30pm with soup, rolls, cakes and biscuits, and finish at 4.30pm. A collection and drop-off service is available and there is TV, games and internet access (subject to 4G signal).
